Public Member Functions
sys::Messenger Class Reference

Documentation

This class creates a new thread dedicated to handling message passing.

Public Member Functions

 Messenger (int stack_size=2048)
 
virtual void handle_message (fmt::Son &message)

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

sys::Messenger::Messenger ( int  stack_size = 2048)

Constructs a new messenger with the specified stack size for the thread.

Parameters
stack_sizeThe number of bytes to use for the Messenger thread stack size

Member Function Documentation

virtual void sys::Messenger::handle_message ( fmt::Son &  message)
inlinevirtual

Handles incoming messages.

Parameters
messageA reference to the incoming message

The default action for this method simply ignores all incoming messages. You can re-implement this method using an inherited class to handle messages.

bool sys::Messenger::is_running ( ) const
inline

Returns true if the messenger thread is running.

int sys::Messenger::send_message ( fmt::Son &  message)

Sends a message.

Parameters
messageA reference to the message
Returns
Zero if message was successfully queued

This method will acquire a mutex on the messenger before sending. The mutex may be locked waiting for an incoming message in which case send_message() will wait until that completes before sending.

int sys::Messenger::start ( const char *  device,
int  read_channel,
int  write_channel 
)

Starts the messenger.

Parameters
deviceThe path to the device where messages will be passed
read_channelThe channel to use for reading messages
write_channelThe channel to use for writing messages
Returns
Zero on success
void sys::Messenger::stop ( )

Stops the messenger.
